alert.note: Alert for Cuyahoga; Summit (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 4:25PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...A thunderstorm with torrential rain will impact portions of southeastern Cuyahoga and northern Summit Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 420 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a thunderstorm with torrential rain 7 miles northwest of Cuyahoga Falls, or 12 miles northwest of Akron, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and torrential rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Torrential rain may lead to reduced visibilities, ponding on roadways, and localized flooding. Locations impacted include... North Royalton, Hudson, Twinsburg, Macedonia, Broadview Heights, Brecksville, Bedford, Bedford Heights, Independence, Northfield, Richfield, Walton Hills, Valley View, Boston Heights, Glenwillow and Peninsula. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
